intro: Unona panamensis, commonly known as the Panama elder, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Unona panamensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
